triples.name: Parametric polymorphism
triples.relevance: Foundational concept that allows derivation of free theorems about polymorphic programs from their types.

triples.name: Parametricity
triples.relevance: Core abstraction property that enables the derivation of theorems and program transformations in polymorphic languages.

triples.name: Haskell (programming language)
triples.relevance: The specific functional programming language studied that uses the seq primitive, which breaks standard parametricity results.

triples.name: System F
triples.relevance: The Girard-Reynolds calculus (System F) is the formal theoretical framework extended with fixpoints and algebraic datatypes for this analysis.

triples.name: Fixed-point computation
triples.relevance: Fixpoints are part of the extended calculus being analyzed for parametricity results in the presence of seq.

triples.name: Algebraic data type
triples.relevance: Algebraic datatypes are included in the Haskell subset being studied for parametricity recovery.

triples.name: Program transformation
triples.relevance: Program transformations based on free theorems are the target application area for ensuring soundness in the presence of seq.

triples.name: Loop fission and fusion
triples.relevance: Short cut fusion is a specific program transformation technique that requires parametricity guarantees to be sound.

triples.name: Deforestation (computer science)
triples.relevance: Deforestation/fusion optimization in functional programming requires the parametricity results this paper recovers.

triples.name: Polymorphism (computer science)
triples.relevance: Novel asymmetric restrictions (left-closed, total, admissible relations) on polymorphic parametricity to restore soundness with seq.
